bibl.title: John Matthews v. Henry M. White. Type of Document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: DIPLOMATIC REPRESENTATIVE OF GALICIA (WEST UKRAINIAN REPUBLIC) WASHINGTON, D.C.
File #107 August 26, 1921.
Hon. Alfred Hampton, Assistant Commissioner General Bureau of Immigration, Washington D.C.
Dear Sir:

An application for passport for Yan Matveyeff alias John Matthews, a native of East Galicia, has been turned over to mt by the Ukrainian Diplomatic Mission, together with other documents bearing on his case.
A passport for the applicant and the documents are herewith enclosed as requested.

Respectfully,
Diplomatic Representative of Galicia
US DEPARTMENT OF LABOR IMMIGRATION SERVICE DISTRICT NO.16
IN REPLYING REFER TO NO. 37012/600
DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS U.S. COMMISSIONER OF IMMIGRATION SEATTLE, WASH.
Commissioner General of Immigration, Washington, D.C.

Referring to Bureau file 54904/149, I have to advise that JOHN MATTHEWS has made application for writ of habeas corpus, and I have been instructed to show cause on September 6, 1921, why writ should not issue.

The application for the writ raods in part as follows, "That ever since said date (the date of the issuance of the warrant of deportation February 19, 1921) your petitioner has been and still is unlawfully and unreasonably restrained of his liberty in the County Jail of King County by Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration aforesaid, under the pretended authority of said warrant or order of deportation and that said restraint is unreasonable and unlawful in this: that the government of the United States, as your deponent is informed and believes, has no diplomatic relations with the government of Ukranua and is unable to execute its order or warrant of deportation of aforesaid and is unable to deport your petitioner to said Ukrania and is making no attempt to do so and has no intention of so doing, and that unless the said Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration aforesaid, is prevented from so doing he will continue unlawfully and unreasonably to restrain your petitioner of his liberty and confine him as a prisoner in the County Jail of King Couty aforesaid, all in violation of your petitioner's right under the Constitution and alws of the United States.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays an order directing the Clerk of this Court to issue under its seal a writ of habeas corpus directed at Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration, requiring him to produce the body of your petitioner in the above entitled court at such time as the Court may fix and then and there show cause, if any he has, why your petitioner should be further restrained of his liberty.
(Signed) Jack Matthews, Petitioner (Signed) Geo. H. Anderson, Attorney for Petitioner
Commissioner General. August 19, 1921.

I request that the Bureau's file properly certified for use in court be promptly forwarded, and taht I be advised as to whether or not a passport has been secured, and if not whether there is any likelihood that a passport will be forthecoming in the near future.
I would also appreciate the receipt of any suggestions which the Bureau may be able to make.
Henry M. White Commissioner
TWL/R
Representative of Ukrainia in Ameries, 1901 Columbia Bond, N.W. Washington, D.C.
Sir:

This letter will be presented by Mr. E M. Kline, a representative of thie Bureau. It is desired to secure a Ukrainian passport for the alien Yan Motveyeff, alias John Matthews. This man on the advices of his attorney refuses to sign the application herewith, and the Bureau will be obliged to you if this passport could be issued without his signature. Mr. Kline will present to you the hearing given this man and also a copy of a letter received from the alien's brother, which states that he was born in Kaminets, Podolska, Ukrainia.
Respectfully
Assistant Commissioner General.
LBR;BC
COPY
